docs.abstract: Todd Akin's imbecilic comments don't fall all that far outside the new right-wing mainstream.
docs.snippet: Todd Akin's imbecilic comments don't fall all that far outside the new right-wing mainstream.

headline.main: Akin Comments Unlikely to Come Up at Romney-Ryan Event

docs.abstract: A Senate candidate's comments on abortion may be the topic of the day, but there's little chance the Romney-Ryan ticket will address it at a campaign event in New Hampshire.
docs.snippet: A Senate candidate's comments on abortion may be the topic of the day, but there's little chance the Romney-Ryan ticket will address it at a campaign event in New Hampshire.

docs.abstract: I'd heard new motherhood could be fraught with panic. But compared to my old terrors, fussing over purees and playgrounds was a pleasure.
docs.snippet: I'd heard new motherhood could be fraught with panic. But compared to my old terrors, fussing over purees and playgrounds was a pleasure.

headline.main: Romney Statement on Abortion Contradicts Ryan's Earlier Stance

docs.abstract: In the past, Representative Paul D. Ryan has opposed abortion in the case of rape, despite a campaign statement that neither he nor Mitt Romney opposes abortion in rape cases.
docs.snippet: In the past, Representative Paul D. Ryan has opposed abortion in the case of rape, despite a campaign statement that neither he nor Mitt Romney opposes abortion in rape cases.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: In an effort to explain his stance on abortion, Representative Todd Akin of Missouri said women’s bodies can somehow block an unwanted pregnancy in instances of “legitimate rape.”

headline.seo: Todd Akin Provokes Ire With ‘Legitimate Rape’ Comment
headline.main: Senate Candidate Provokes Ire With ‘Legitimate Rape’ Comment
headline.print_headline: In Rapes, Candidate Says, Body Can Block Pregnancy

docs.abstract: Rep Todd Akin, Republican Senate nominee from Missouri, provokes ire across the political spectrum by saying that in instances of what he calls 'legitimate rape,' women's bodies can somehow block an unwanted pregnancy; statement was given in answer to a question about his stance on abortion.
docs.snippet: In an effort to explain his stance on abortion, Representative Todd Akin of Missouri said women’s bodies can somehow block an unwanted pregnancy in instances of “legitimate rape.”

byline.contributor: John Eligon reported from Kansas City, and Michael Schwirtz from New York. Rebecca Berg contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ

headline.main: Candidate's Comments on Rape Draw Criticism

docs.abstract: Representative Todd Akin of Missouri asserted that victims of “a legitimate rape” have biological mechanisms to prevent pregnancy.
docs.snippet: Representative Todd Akin of Missouri asserted that victims of “a legitimate rape” have biological mechanisms to prevent pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Still-pudgy moms struggling to find their way back are bombarded by the celebrity narrative of the mom as bombshell in a looks obsessed culture.

headline.seo: In Celebrity Climate, From Bump to Paunch, Pudgy Moms Can’t Get a Break
headline.main: Can a Mom Get a Break?
headline.print_headline: Can a Mom Get A Break?

docs.abstract: Cultural Studies column finds that in America's looks-obsessed culture, not even busy mothers get a break, bombarded by the celebrity narrative of the mom as bombshell.
docs.snippet: Still-pudgy moms struggling to find their way back are bombarded by the celebrity narrative of the mom as bombshell in a looks obsessed culture.

docs.lead_paragraph: Alix Ohlin’s characters struggle to make personal connections.

headline.seo: ‘Inside’ and ‘Signs and Wonders,’ by Alix Ohlin

docs.abstract: William Giraldi reviews books Inside and Signs and Wonders: Stories, both by Alix Ohlin.
docs.snippet: Alix Ohlin’s characters struggle to make personal connections.

docs.lead_paragraph: New data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention suggest that teenagers are about as likely to have intercourse before engaging in oral sex as they are to have oral sex first.

headline.seo: Data Suggest Teenagers Not More Likely to Have Oral Sex First
headline.main: Sex Life of Teenagers Is Subject of Study
headline.print_headline: Sex Life Of Teenagers Is Subject Of Study

docs.abstract: Data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention suggests that teenagers are about as likely to have intercourse before engaging in oral sex as they are to have oral sex first; finding challenges popular perception that teenagers who are not ready for intercourse are experimenting with oral sex en masse.
docs.snippet: New data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention suggest that teenagers are about as likely to have intercourse before engaging in oral sex as they are to have oral sex first.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

docs.lead_paragraph: Jonathan Tropper’s sixth novel is about Drew Silver, a divorced part-time drummer in an over-the-hill rock band, supporting himself partly by selling specimens to a sperm bank.

headline.seo: ‘One Last Thing Before I Go’ by Jonathan Tropper
headline.main: A Man’s Humdrum Life Suddenly Turns Potent
headline.print_headline: A Man’s Humdrum Life Suddenly Turns Potent

docs.abstract: Janet Maslin reviews book One Last Thing Before I Go by Jonathan Tropper.
docs.snippet: Jonathan Tropper’s sixth novel is about Drew Silver, a divorced part-time drummer in an over-the-hill rock band, supporting himself partly by selling specimens to a sperm bank.
